TermDefinition.DefinitionText: Describes breast cancer cells that do not have estrogen receptors, progesterone receptors, or large amounts of HER2/neu protein. Also called triple-negative breast cancer.

ER-negative PR-negative HER2/neu-negative breast cancer is defined by a lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PR), and human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2/neu). Also called triple-negative breast cancer.

MediaLink.alt: Pronunciation of dictionary term "ER-negative PR-negative HER2/neu-negative breast cancer"

GlossaryTerm.SpanishTermName: cáncer de mama RE negativo, RP negativo, HER2/neu negativo

SpanishTermDefinition.DefinitionText: Describe las células de cáncer de mama que no tienen receptores de estrógeno, receptores de progesterona o grandes cantidades de la proteína HER2/neu. También se llama cáncer de mama triple negativo.
